frameDefinitions: This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.
A Subpart of a Time_period is picked out.
An Agent has access to a finite amount of some Resource and uses it in some way to complete a Purpose.
A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
This frame involves a Creator making a duplicate, the Copy, of some Original entity.
frameExamples: On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
The claimant should then submit medical certificates for the duration of their <t>absence</t> from work.INI
I nearly kicked my TV this afternoon after watching the shambolic <t><fex name='subpar'>end</fex></t> of the Austrian Grand-Prix .
I <t>used</t> half of the bag of dirt to plant the roses.
Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
The teacher <t>copied</t> the problem onto the blackboard.
listRoleDefinitions: The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
The person who is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen> of time.
This role describes the activity or responsiblilities from which the <fen>Person</fen> is taking a temporary leave.
The amount of time the <fen>Person</fen> is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen>.  This can also be expressed as a description of a duration, as shown below:
The time at which the leave occurs.
The part of the <fen>Time_period</fen> which is profiled.
A temporal span conceived of as a whole.
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> that is being referred to.
The person who depletes a Resource to achieve some Goal
The exhaustible commodity that the <fen>Agent</fen> has access to.
What the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to achieve by using the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The amount of the <fen>Resource</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> uses to achieve the <fen>Purpose</fen>.
A more specific description of how the <fen>Purpose</fen> is achieved by spending the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Resource</fen> is used.
The physical location where the <fen>Resource</fen> is used.
The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Copy</fen> based on the <fen>Original</fen>.  It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
The <fen>Original</fen> is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object:
The <fen>Copy</fen> produced by the <fen>Creator</fen> is frequently not expressed. However, when <fen>Copy</fen> does occur, it is usually expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes <fen>Place</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The voters</fex> elected Blair.
The students overthrew <fex>the president</fex>.
The president appoints <fex>the prime minister</fex>.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
The rebels overthrew <fex>the dictatorship</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.
During his <fex>wife's</fex> absence, Linkworth and his mother had another violent argument.
Such conditions would be likely to lead to absence <fex>from work</fex>.
Dissuaded from resigning, Macmillan took <fex>extended</fex> leave rather than restrain his public utterances.
Columbus took leave of the known world <fex>on 6 September 1492</fex>.
The findings mark the <fex>beginning</fex> of a new age of planetary science, in which 'extrasolar' planets can be directly measured and compared.
A zillion copies and clones have been made of this Russian game since it first was released in the mid <fex>80's</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
I found him <fex>under the bed</fex>.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
We found it <fex>last night</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> photocopied the article.
Pat photocopied <fex>the article</fex>.
<fex>The results</fex> replicate those of an earlier study.
